name: hellojs-android
body: # hellojs-android This application provides an interface to running JavaScript with SpiderMonkey on Android * Place your scripts (.js files) in the _assets_ folder * [Build](#Build) the app * Install _HelloJS.apk_ * Launch the _SpiderMonkey HelloJS_ application * The first screen will display version info about the SpiderMonkey VM and bindings * Click 'Scripts' to display a list of JavaScript files that was placed in _assets_ * Select the script you want to run * The return value of the scripts will be displayed in adb's _logcat_ ## Screenshots ## Build ##### Prerequisites * [spidermonkey](http://folecr.github.com/spidermonkey) * Android SDK * Android NDK ``` > cd hellojs-android > ant clean && rm -rf obj && rm -rf libs && rm -rf bin > NDK_ROOT=/android-ndk MOZILLA_ROOT=~/ws/mozilla ./build_native.sh > ant debug ``` ## Authors and Contributors * @funkaster (iOS) * @folecr (Android) * The Mozilla SpiderMonkey team (duh)
tagline: An Android app that runs JavaScript with SpiderMonkey
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
